alert.note: Alert for McCreary (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 12:38PM EST until January 12 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following areas, in south central Kentucky, Laurel, McCreary, Pulaski, Rockcastle, Wayne and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Clay, Jackson and Knox. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1235 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain falling across the area. The rainfall in combination with the melting snow is causing excessive runoff. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain in combination with snow melt will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, London, Monticello, Williamsburg, Barbourville, Mount Vernon, Manchester, McKee, Whitley City, Boone, Science Hill, Burnside, Rockcastle Springs, Baldrock, Holly Bay Rec. Area, Bunch, Mount Victory, Huxley, Hightop and Vox.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
